Organization: Source of raw data: Agência Nacional de Águas (ANA), Brazil. Source of derived data: Energy and Resources Group and Sally Thompson Ecohydrology Lab, University of California (UC), Berkeley.
SourceDescription: The Agência Nacional de Águas (ANA) is the Brazilian government water management agency. Please see original data package documentation for more information on original source (available at: https://dx.doi.org/10.6084/m9.figshare.3100912). The Energy and Resources Group (ERG) is an independent interdisciplinary group within the College of Natural Resources (CNR) at UC Berkeley. The Sally Thompson Ecohydrology Lab is a part of the Environmental Fluid Mechanics and Hydrology (EFMH) group within the Department of Civil and Environmental Engineering (CEE) at UC Berkeley.
Citation: Levy, Morgan. Curated Rain and Flow Data for the Brazilian Rainforest-Savanna Transition Zone. Figshare. https://dx.doi.org/10.6084/m9.figshare.3100912
Title: Curated Rain and Flow Data for the Brazilian Rainforest-Savanna Transition Zone
Abstract: Curated set of long-term, historical (intermittent, 1950 - 2013) daily rainfall and streamflow data from a large region spanning the southern Amazonian rainforest to tropical savanna biomes of Brazil. The curated data set was derived from free, publicly-available rainfall, streamflow, and associated geographic information systems (GIS) data obtained primarily from the Brazilian government water management agency, and also from the government electricity regulatory agency: Agência Nacional de Águas (ANA) and Agência Nacional de Energia Elétrica (ANEEL), respectively.
